contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Klaus Wunderlich | image = klauswunderlich.jpg | caption = Klaus Wunderlich | image_size = 200px | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date|1931|6|18|df=y}} |birth_place =[[Chemnitz]], [[Saxony]], [[Germany]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1997|10|28|1931|6|18|df=y}} |death_place = [[Engen, Germany|Engen]], [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]] | origin = | instrument = [[Keyboard instrument]]s, [[Percussion]] | genre = [[Classical music|Classical]], [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Jazz]], [[Folk music|Folk]] | occupation = [[Musician]] | years_active = 1947–1997 | label = | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.klauswunderlich.de/ KlausWunderlich.de] | current_members = | past_members = | notable_instruments = }} '''Klaus Wunderlich''' (June 18, 1931 - October 28, 1997) was a [[Germany|German]] [[musician]]. Wunderlich was born in [[Chemnitz]] and died in [[Engen, Germany|Engen]] from a heart attack. Wunderlich played the [[Hammond organ]] during the first half of his career, and later switched to [[Wersi]] organs and [[Moog synthesizer]]s with which he created his own unique electronic sound. He was open to different music styles and played classical, operetta, [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] musical, as well as popular music. He sold more than 20 million records all over the world and received 13 golden albums as well as one golden cassette. He has something of a cult following, and pops up from time to time in the playlists of contemporary DJs. Some of his work was put into the [[Soviet]] [[cartoon]], [[Nu Pogodi!]] ==External links== *[http://www.klauswunderlich.de Wunderlich's website] in German and English *[http://www.sunkit.com/klaus-wunderlich/ Sunkit's page about Klaus Wunderlich] in Swedish {{Authority control|VIAF=24788953}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wunderlich, Klaus | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German organist | DATE OF BIRTH = 18 June 1931 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Chemnitz]], [[Saxony]], [[Germany]] | DATE OF DEATH = 28 October 1997 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Engen, Germany|Engen]], [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wunderlich, Klaus}} [[Category:1931 births]] [[Category:1997 deaths]] [[Category:People from Chemnitz]] [[Category:German musicians]] [[Category:German organists]] [[Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction]] {{Germany-musician-stub}} {{organist-stub}}
